info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 7:01PM EDT until August 27 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including parks, greenways, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in less than an hour, especially in a very localized area around Uptown Charlotte. This is causing rapid rises on small drainages and streams in Charlotte, including Little Sugar Creek, especially near Medical Center Dr. Flooding of the Little Sugar Creek greenway is ongoing and will persist over the next 60-90 minutes. Heavy rainfall is ending from west to east across Charlotte, with another 0.50-1 inch possible towards Mint Hill. Thereafter, additional heavy rainfall is not expected over the next 1-2 hours. However, additional heavy rainfall is possible later tonight and new areas of flooding may develop. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Matthews, Mint Hill, Pineville, Harrisburg, The Plaza, Freedom Park, Hidden Valley, Southpark Mall, Reedy Creek Park, The Arboretum, and University City.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
